data.title: Add, remove, and edit photos in a shared album in Photos on Mac
data.meta_description: In Photos on your Mac, add, edit, and remove photos and video clips in your shared albums.
data.text:
To edit a photo or video in an album someone else shared with you, you must first import the photo into your library. You can then edit it as you would any other photo. Edits you make to the photo in your library don’t change the original photo in the shared album.

In the Photos app on your Mac, click a shared album under Shared Albums in the sidebar.

Navigate to the photo you want to edit, double-click it, then click Edit.

Click Import.

Click Edit.

Make changes to the photo, then click Done.

Your edited photo appears in the Imports album and in a day in Photos view. To move the edited photo to another album, select it, choose Image > Add to, then create a new album or place the photo in an existing one. To add the edited photo to the shared album again, click Shared in the toolbar, open the shared album, then click “Add photos and videos.”
